intro: Palicourea veraguensis, commonly known as the Veraguas moonseed, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Palicourea veraguensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
